newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Saurer completes BB Industrie buy.
newsitem.headline: Saurer completes BB Industrie buy.

text.p: Saurer AG said it now owns a total 99.1 percent of the share capital of BB Industrie Holding AG as the result of its takeover offer, which expired on May 22.

It said 130,086 sales, or 89.3 percent of the 145,692 bearer shares outstanding as of May 7, were tendered in response to its offer. These shares, together with stock purchased before and during the offer, Saurer now holds 247,843 shares, or 99.1 percent of both share capital and voting rights, it said.
Saurer had been offering to pay three of its own registered shares and 645 Swiss francs in cash for each BB Industrie bearer share.
BB Industrie was founded as an investment company to hold stakes in Swiss and European industrial companies.
But a 32 percent stake in Saurer's shares and cash are its two main assets now since it sold a 35 percent stake in Swiss textile machinery and automotive supply group Rieter Holding AG in March.
